00052 #include <stdexcept>

00055 /**
00056  * \brief Namespace for %GeographicLib
00057  *
00058  * All of %GeographicLib is defined within the GeographicLib namespace.  In
00059  * addtion all the header files are included via %GeographicLib/filename.  This
00060  * minimizes the likelihood of conflicts with other packages.
00061  **********************************************************************/
00062 namespace GeographicLib {
00063 
00064   /**
00065    * \brief %Constants needed by %GeographicLib
00066    *
00067    * Define constants specifying the WGS84 ellipsoid, the UTM and UPS
00068    * projections, and various unit conversions.
00069    **********************************************************************/
00070   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT Constants {
00071   private:
00072     typedef Math::real real;
00073     Constants();                // Disable constructor
00074 
00075   public:
00076     /**
00077      * A synonym for Math::degree<real>().
00078      **********************************************************************/
00079     static inline Math::real degree() throw() { return Math::degree<real>(); }
00080     /**
00081      * @return the number of radians in an arcminute.
00082      **********************************************************************/
00083     static inline Math::real arcminute() throw()
00084     { return Math::degree<real>() / 60; }
00085     /**
00086      * @return the number of radians in an arcsecond.
00087      **********************************************************************/
00088     static inline Math::real arcsecond() throw()
00089     { return Math::degree<real>() / 3600; }
00090 
00091     /** \name Ellipsoid parameters
00092      **********************************************************************/
00093     ///@{
00094     /**
00095      * @return the equatorial radius of WGS84 ellipsoid (6378137 m).
00096      **********************************************************************/
00097     template<typename T>
00098     static inline T WGS84_a() throw() { return T(6378137) * meter<T>(); }
00099     /**
00100      * A synonym for WGS84_a<real>().
00101      **********************************************************************/
00102     static inline Math::real WGS84_a() throw() { return WGS84_a<real>(); }
00103     /**
00104      * @return the flattening of WGS84 ellipsoid (1/298.257223563).
00105      **********************************************************************/
00106     template<typename T>
00107     static inline T WGS84_f() throw() {
00108       return T(1) / ( T(298) + T(257223563) / T(1000000000) );
00109     }
00110     /**
00111      * A synonym for WGS84_f<real>().
00112      **********************************************************************/
00113     static inline Math::real WGS84_f() throw() { return WGS84_f<real>(); }
00114     /**
00115      * <b>DEPRECATED</b>
00116      * @return the reciprocal flattening of WGS84 ellipsoid.
00117      **********************************************************************/
00118     template<typename T>
00119     static inline T WGS84_r() throw() { return 1/WGS84_f<T>(); }
00120     /**
00121      * <b>DEPRECATED</b>
00122      * A synonym for WGS84_r<real>().
00123      **********************************************************************/
00124     static inline Math::real WGS84_r() throw() { return WGS84_r<real>(); }
00125     /**
00126      * @return the central scale factor for UTM (0.9996).
00127      **********************************************************************/
00128     template<typename T>
00129     static inline T UTM_k0() throw() {return T(9996) / T(10000); }
00130     /**
00131      * A synonym for UTM_k0<real>().
00132      **********************************************************************/
00133     static inline Math::real UTM_k0() throw() { return UTM_k0<real>(); }
00134     /**
00135      * @return the central scale factor for UPS (0.994).
00136      **********************************************************************/
00137     template<typename T>
00138     static inline T UPS_k0() throw() { return T(994) / T(1000); }
00139     /**
00140      * A synonym for UPS_k0<real>().
00141      **********************************************************************/
00142     static inline Math::real UPS_k0() throw() { return UPS_k0<real>(); }
00143     ///@}
00144 
00145     /** \name SI units
00146      **********************************************************************/
00147     ///@{
00148     /**
00149      * @return the number of meters in a meter.
00150      *
00151      * This is unity, but this lets the internal system of units be changed if
00152      * necessary.
00153      **********************************************************************/
00154     template<typename T>
00155     static inline T meter() throw() { return T(1); }
00156     /**
00157      * A synonym for meter<real>().
00158      **********************************************************************/
00159     static inline Math::real meter() throw() { return meter<real>(); }
00160     /**
00161      * @return the number of meters in a kilometer.
00162      **********************************************************************/
00163     static inline Math::real kilometer() throw()
00164     { return 1000 * meter<real>(); }
00165     /**
00166      * @return the number of meters in a nautical mile (approximately 1 arc
00167      *   minute)
00168      **********************************************************************/
00169     static inline Math::real nauticalmile() throw()
00170     { return 1852 * meter<real>(); }
00171 
00172     /**
00173      * @return the number of square meters in a square meter.
00174      *
00175      * This is unity, but this lets the internal system of units be changed if
00176      * necessary.
00177      **********************************************************************/
00178     template<typename T>
00179       static inline T square_meter() throw()
00180     { return meter<real>() * meter<real>(); }
00181     /**
00182      * A synonym for square_meter<real>().
00183      **********************************************************************/
00184     static inline Math::real square_meter() throw()
00185     { return square_meter<real>(); }
00186     /**
00187      * @return the number of square meters in a hectare.
00188      **********************************************************************/
00189     static inline Math::real hectare() throw()
00190     { return 10000 * square_meter<real>(); }
00191     /**
00192      * @return the number of square meters in a square kilometer.
00193      **********************************************************************/
00194     static inline Math::real square_kilometer() throw()
00195     { return kilometer() * kilometer(); }
00196     /**
00197      * @return the number of square meters in a square nautical mile.
00198      **********************************************************************/
00199     static inline Math::real square_nauticalmile() throw()
00200     { return nauticalmile() * nauticalmile(); }
00201     ///@}
00202 
00203     /** \name Anachronistic British units
00204      **********************************************************************/
00205     ///@{
00206     /**
00207      * @return the number of meters in an international foot.
00208      **********************************************************************/
00209     static inline Math::real foot() throw()
00210     { return real(0.0254L) * 12 * meter<real>(); }
00211     /**
00212      * @return the number of meters in a yard.
00213      **********************************************************************/
00214     static inline Math::real yard() throw() { return 3 * foot(); }
00215     /**
00216      * @return the number of meters in a fathom.
00217      **********************************************************************/
00218     static inline Math::real fathom() throw() { return 2 * yard(); }
00219     /**
00220      * @return the number of meters in a chain.
00221      **********************************************************************/
00222     static inline Math::real chain() throw() { return 22 * yard(); }
00223     /**
00224      * @return the number of meters in a furlong.
00225      **********************************************************************/
00226     static inline Math::real furlong() throw() { return 10 * chain(); }
00227     /**
00228      * @return the number of meters in a statute mile.
00229      **********************************************************************/
00230     static inline Math::real mile() throw() { return 8 * furlong(); }
00231     /**
00232      * @return the number of square meters in an acre.
00233      **********************************************************************/
00234     static inline Math::real acre() throw() { return chain() * furlong(); }
00235     /**
00236      * @return the number of square meters in a square statute mile.
00237      **********************************************************************/
00238     static inline Math::real square_mile() throw() { return mile() * mile(); }
00239     ///@}
00240 
00241     /** \name Anachronistic US units
00242      **********************************************************************/
00243     ///@{
00244     /**
00245      * @return the number of meters in a US survey foot.
00246      **********************************************************************/
00247     static inline Math::real surveyfoot() throw()
00248     { return real(1200) / real(3937) * meter<real>(); }
00249     ///@}
00250   };
00251 
00252   /**
00253    * \brief Exception handling for %GeographicLib
00254    *
00255    * A class to handle exceptions.  It's derived from std::runtime_error so it
00256    * can be caught by the usual catch clauses.
00257    **********************************************************************/
00258   class GeographicErr : public std::runtime_error {
00259   public:
00260 
00261     /**
00262      * Constructor
00263      *
00264      * @param[in] msg a string message, which is accessible in the catch
00265      *   clause, via what().
00266      **********************************************************************/
00267     GeographicErr(const std::string& msg) : std::runtime_error(msg) {}
00268   };
00269 
00270 } // namespace GeographicLib
00271 
00272 #endif  // GEOGRAPHICLIB_CONSTANTS_HPP
